identificationModule.briefTitle: Point of Care Ultrasound for the Detection of Esophageal Food Bolus
identificationModule.officialTitle: Point of Care Ultrasound for the Detection of Esophageal Food Bolus

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Research Director - Department of Emergency Medicine

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
This will be a prospective, observational, case-control study of adult patients presenting to the WellSpan York Hospital Emergency Department (YHED) with signs and symptoms of esophageal food or foreign body impaction. Point of care ultrasound (POCUS) will then be performed by a trained emergency physician to collect ultrasound data, including the presence or absence of direct visualization food bolus/foreign body, as well as secondary markers of dilatation, such as maximal esophageal area. Investigators will also enroll an age/sex-matched control group of asymptomatic individuals to establish baseline esophageal measurements.

Patients will otherwise receive medical treatment per standard of care. Subsequent interventions will also be documented, including glucagon, carbonated beverages, and esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD). If patients remain in the ED and improve without need for EGD they will undergo repeat ultrasound. Chart review at 1 month will be performed to establish results of EGD including improvement, recurrence, or presence of pathologic abnormalities. The investigators aim to establish normal and abnormal parameters to aid in the diagnosis of esophageal food impactions to predict need for definitive EGD management.

armGroups.label: Esophageal foreign body/impaction (suspected)
interventionNames: Diagnostic Test: Point of care ultrasound

armGroups.label: Control (No symptoms of esophageal foreign body/impaction)
interventionNames: Diagnostic Test: Point of care ultrasound

interventions.name: Point of care ultrasound
interventions.description:
Point of care medical ultrasound machines will be used to sonographically visualize the esophagus and following sonographic data will be collected:

* Presence/absence of suspected foreign body
* Sonographic esophageal measurements (diameters, area)
* Other relevant secondary sonographic findings
armGroupLabels: Control (No symptoms of esophageal foreign body/impaction)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Presence or absence of esophageal foreign body/food impaction
primaryOutcomes.description: Presence of absence of esophageal foreign body/food impaction on esophagogastroduodenoscopy
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 48 hours of index visit (Emergency department arrival to emergency department or hospital discharge)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number/proportion of subjects experiencing resolution of symptoms with standard medical therapies
secondaryOutcomes.description: Number/proportion of subjects experiencing resolution of symptoms with standard medical therapies, including glucagon and carbonated beverages
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 48 hours of index visit (Emergency department arrival to emergency department or hospital discharge)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number/proportion of subjects requiring endoscopic intervention
secondaryOutcomes.description: Number/proportion of subjects needing interventional procedures during esophagogastroduodenoscopy due to esophageal symptoms
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 48 hours of index visit (Emergency department arrival to emergency department or hospital discharge)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Eligibility (CASES)

* Inclusion criteria:

  1. Age ≥18 years
  2. Signs and symptoms of esophageal food bolus or foreign body
* Exclusion criteria:

  1. Prior esophageal surgery
  2. History of head/neck cancer
  3. Incarcerated individuals
  4. Individuals unable to provide consent
  5. Clinical instability or airway compromise

Eligibility (CONTROLS)

* Inclusion criteria:

  1. Age ≥18 years
  2. NO signs or symptoms of esophageal food bolus or foreign body
  3. Age/Sex match to previously enrolled case subject
* Exclusion criteria:

  1. Prior esophageal surgery/dilation/pathology
  2. History of head/neck cancer
  3. Incarcerated individuals
  4. Individuals unable to provide consent
  5. Clinical instability or airway compromise
  6. Presentation involving any of the following symptoms:
* Nausea/vomiting
* Diarrhea
* Abdominal pain
* Chest pain
* Shortness of breath
* Dysphagia/odynophagia
* Cough
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: This will be a case-control study of adult patients presenting to the WellSpan York Hospital Emergency Department (YHED) with signs and symptoms of esophageal food or foreign body impaction. We will also enroll an age/sex-matched control group of asymptomatic individuals to establish baseline esophageal measurements.
